learning_outcomes.description: Appreciate the overall context and need for information security within a business environment.
Analyse security issues and propose security policies in terms of the fundamental security goals of confidentiality, integrity, authentication, availability, and non-repudiation.
Understand and utilise the critical importance of risk management and continuity management in driving the overall business information security towards tangible continuous improvement.
Analyse, evaluate and plan the deployment of the major technological controls that are relevant within business information security.

assessments.task_description:
The assignment will comprise a series of analysis questions that focus on the course material covered from lecture 1 to lecture 5.

The student response to each question cannot exceed 300 words.

The assignment will be individually completed by each student.

We shall introduce and discuss this assignment in lecture 1 (and subsequent lectures) it will also be available via the Course Blackboard site.


The assignment is to be completed and submitted via both Blackboard link and Turnitin link (marks will be released on blackboard only).


This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment must be submitted electronically via both the course Blackboard assessment link and Turnitin link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

assessments.task_description:
The assignment will comprise a series of critical analysis questions that focus on the course material covered across the course. The word limit for a student response to each question is 300 words. The assignment will be individually completed by each student.


This assignment 2 will be available via the course Blackboard site after all assignment 1 questions have been released. The assignment is to be completed and submitted via both Blackboard link and Turnitin link (marks will be released on blackboard only).

We shall introduce and discuss this assignment in the relevant lecture (and subsequent lectures).


This assessment task evaluates students' abilities, skills and knowledge without the aid of Artificial Intelligence (AI). Students are advised that the use of AI technologies to develop responses is strictly prohibited and may constitute student misconduct under the Student Code of Conduct.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The assignment must be submitted electronically both via the course Blackboard assessment link and Turnitin link.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Introduction to Information Security

We introduce the concept of information security and the fundamental view we shall use to analyse this topic.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Introduction to Information Security We introduce the concept of information security and the fundamental view we shall use to analyse this topic.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 1 - An Intro to Information Security

Information Security Discussion 1 - An Introduction to Information Security and passwords.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 1 - An Intro to Information Security Information Security Discussion 1 - An Introduction to Information Security and passwords.

learning_activities.topic:
The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues

We discuss the need for information security - types of security threats. We introduce a range of Australian IT related laws and the advantages/disadvantages these pose.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_title: The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues
learning_activities.topic_description: The Need for Security / Legal and Ethical Issues We discuss the need for information security - types of security threats. We introduce a range of Australian IT related laws and the advantages/disadvantages these pose.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 2 - The Need for Security

Information Security Discussion 2 - Review questions cover The Need for Security and the topic of phishing.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 2 - The Need for Security Information Security Discussion 2 - Review questions cover The Need for Security and the topic of phishing.

learning_activities.topic:
Planning for Security

We discuss management's role in the development, maintenance, and enforcement of information security policy and standards. We explain what an information security blueprint is in the context of the ISO 27000 series. We introduce contingency planning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Planning for Security We discuss management's role in the development, maintenance, and enforcement of information security policy and standards. We explain what an information security blueprint is in the context of the ISO 27000 series. We introduce contingency planning.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 3 - Planning for Security

Information Security Discussion 3 - We cover the role of management, ISO 27000, contingency planning and network scanning.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 3 -  Planning for Security Information Security Discussion 3 - We cover the role of management, ISO 27000, contingency planning and network scanning.

learning_activities.topic: Ekka Day Public Holiday (Content presented next week)
learning_activities.topic_title: Ekka Day Public Holiday (Content presented next week)
learning_activities.topic_description: Ekka Day Public Holiday (Content presented next week)

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 4 - Risk Management I

Information Security Discussion 4 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 1) and key loggers.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 4 - Risk Management I Information Security Discussion 4 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 1) and key loggers.

learning_activities.topic:
Risk Management (Part 1 and Part 2)

In the first part, we focus on defining risk management and its role in the organisation. We describe risk management techniques to identify and prioritise risk factors for assets. We explain how risk is assessed.

In the second part, we discuss strategy options used to treat risk. We formulate a cost-benefit analysis (CBA) using existing conceptual frameworks. We describe popular methodologies used in business to manage risk.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Risk Management (Part 1 and Part 2) In the first part, we focus on defining risk management and its role in the organisation. We describe risk management techniques to identify and prioritise risk factors for assets. We explain how risk is assessed. In the second part, we discuss strategy options used to treat risk. We formulate a cost-benefit analysis (CBA) using existing conceptual frameworks. We describe popular methodologies used in business to manage risk.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 5 - Risk Management II

Information Security Discussion 5 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 2) and numerals and numerical systems.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 5 - Risk Management II Information Security Discussion 5 - Review questions cover Risk Management (Part 2) and numerals and numerical systems.

learning_activities.topic:
Cryptography (Part 1)

We consider two major encryption paradigms - symmetric key and public key cryptography - their operational strengths and challenges.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Cryptography (Part 1) We consider two major encryption paradigms - symmetric key and public key cryptography - their operational strengths and challenges.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 6 - Cryptography I

Information Security Discussion 6 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 1) - symmetric key and public key cryptography and the deep web.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 6 - Cryptography I Information Security Discussion 6 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 1) - symmetric key and public key cryptography and the deep web.

learning_activities.topic:
Cryptography (Part 2)

We consider the commercial applications of cryptography - hybrid security applications for the Web and Email. We also consider other important applications such as digital signatures.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Cryptography (Part 2) We consider the commercial applications of cryptography - hybrid security applications for the Web and Email. We also consider other important applications such as digital signatures.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 7 - Cryptography II

Information Security Discussion 7 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 2) - commercial applications of cryptography and SQL Injections, Threat Maps & Honeypots.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 7 - Cryptography II Information Security Discussion 7 - Review questions cover Cryptography (Part 2) - commercial applications of cryptography and SQL Injections, Threat Maps & Honeypots.

learning_activities.topic:
Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1)

A business analysis of major types of security controls - operational approaches and positioning within the business network.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_title: Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1)
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Technology (Firewalls, Proxys and the DMZ - Part 1) A business analysis of major types of security controls - operational approaches and positioning within the business network.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 8 - Security Technology I

Information Security Discussion 8 - Review questions cover major types of security controls including firewalls.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 8 - Security Technology I Information Security Discussion 8 - Review questions cover major types of security controls including firewalls.

learning_activities.topic:
Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2)

Consideration of the role of intrusion detection systems - placement and operational approaches. We analyse how intrusion detection systems (IDS) provide 'defence in depth' for the modern business.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Technology (Intrusion Detection - Part 2) Consideration of the role of intrusion detection systems - placement and operational approaches. We analyse how intrusion detection systems (IDS) provide 'defence in depth' for the modern business.

learning_activities.topic:
No Lecture/Tutorials (Mid-Semester Break)

No Lectures or tutorials during in-semester break.
learning_activities.topic_description: No Lecture/Tutorials (Mid-Semester Break) No Lectures or tutorials during in-semester break.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 9 - Security Technology II

Information Security Discussion 9 - Review questions cover Intrusion detection systems (IDS, Kerberos & Kerberos/TLS contrast).

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 9 - Security Technology II Information Security Discussion 9 - Review questions cover Intrusion detection systems (IDS, Kerberos & Kerberos/TLS contrast).

learning_activities.topic:
PCI DSS Discussion & Analysis

A 'capstone' analysis of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). A contractually obligatory standard for any business storing, forwarding or processing in-house credit card data for Visa, Mastercard, and Amex.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: PCI DSS Discussion & Analysis A 'capstone' analysis of the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS). A contractually obligatory standard for any business storing, forwarding or processing in-house credit card data for Visa, Mastercard, and Amex.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 10 - PCI DSS

Information Security Discussion 10 - Review questions cover the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS).

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 10 - PCI DSS Information Security Discussion 10 - Review questions cover the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS).

learning_activities.topic:
Blockchain - Theory & Practice

We analyse the blockchain application. Discussion of the blockchain as it underpins bitcoin (crypto-currency). We focus on its architecture, benefits, challenges, and how it implements hashing and cryptography. A business analysis of the variety of blockchain management paradigms that have emerged in business.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Blockchain - Theory & Practice We analyse the blockchain application. Discussion of the blockchain as it underpins bitcoin (crypto-currency). We focus on its architecture, benefits, challenges, and how it implements hashing and cryptography. A business analysis of the variety of blockchain management paradigms that have emerged in business.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 11 - Blockchain

Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover Blockchain and Network Traffic Analysis.

Learning outcomes: L01, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 11 - Blockchain Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover Blockchain and Network Traffic Analysis.

learning_activities.topic:
Security Maintenance

We focus on security auditing and security testing as part of managing and operating the ongoing security program.

Learning outcomes: L01, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Security Maintenance We focus on security auditing and security testing as part of managing and operating the ongoing security program.

learning_activities.topic:
Tutorial 12 - Q&A session

Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover security auditing, security testing and PCI DSS. Q&A session for assignment 2.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
learning_activities.topic_description: Tutorial 12 -  Q&A session Information Security Discussion 11 - Review questions cover security auditing, security testing and PCI DSS. Q&A session for assignment 2.

Recap and Q&A session

We review the series of seminars. A good opportunity for students to ensure their assignment 2 submission is of a high standard.

Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04
